text: I see. I'm a frontend dev so I some have misconceptions about backend. I think it's a good sign if as you're coding you end up with parts resembling actual products. You might be walking in the footsteps of the Heroku guys.

text: Good abstractions tend to re-appear if you're not explicitly trying to re-invent them

elements.text: Good abstractions tend to re-appear if you're not explicitly trying to re-invent them

text: Tyretool is basically a web version of Filemaker Pro without any of the graphical customization possibilities at $10/user/month, so slightly cheaper than filemaker pro pricing for small user bases, but a great deal more expensive for large numbers of users. Filemaker Pro may still have a poor scripting language, but it is extremely powerful, and i have used Filemaker Pro many times for small databases because it is so easy to work with, and so well documented at this point, being 20+ years old. Filemaker Pro is one of those products like Delphi that gets zero love because it is so simple.
